name: Polenta Pizza
description: When we had our restaurant, one of our specials on Thursday night was polenta and chicken. We always had polenta left over and Dad would complain about the waste. I came up with this idea and boy did it take off! Johnny would grill a slice of polenta on the grill and then add sausage, mushrooms, peppers, and onions and then top it with a little sauce and mozzarella.
recipeIngredient: 1 (3.5 ounce) link hot Italian sausage, sliced
¼ cup sliced fresh mushrooms, or more to taste
1 slice prepared polenta, cut into 4x4-inch piece
¼ cup spaghetti sauce, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil on a griddle or large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion, green bell pepper, sausage, and mushrooms until sausage is fully cooked and onions are lightly browned, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from griddle.

Place polenta on the same hot griddle; cook until warmed through, about 5 minutes per side. Layer polenta with vegetable-sausage mixture, spaghetti sauce, and mozzarella cheese. Cook on griddle until cheese is melted, 5 to 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made Polenta Pizza Last night and it was outstanding. As soon as I saw the recipe I HAD to have it. Made a basic polenta with chicken broth and Golden Pheasant "Polenta type degerminated corn meal" which my Raley's carries. I spread it in sheet a cake pan and chilled. I cut into rectangles about 4" X 6" and pan fried briefly in a dab of olive oil. I didn't have mushrooms and almost made a several mile trip just to buy some but in the end made do with sweet Italian sausage onions peppers Italian seasoning sauce and mozzarella. It was heaven. I will make it again with lots of sautéed mushrooms...like TOMORROW! Thanks for an outstanding recipe!

I had never had polenta before but I did have a package of prepared polenta on the shelf which I had purchased quite some time ago. Not wanting to waste it I searched and found this recipe. Instead of cooking it in a skillet, I sliced it 1/2 inch thick, brushed a little olive oil on both sides and placed them on a foil lined baking sheet and broiled them until they turned slightly browned on both sides. While that was happening I cooked onions, garlic, mushrooms and the sausage in the skillet. Hubby doesn't like peppers but I bet they would have been great in this. I cooked it all until their juices dried up before adding the spaghetti sauce. When it was all nice and hot I poured it all on top of the polenta on the baking sheet, sprinkled a little parmesan and covered it with mozzarella cheese. I put this back under the broiler until the cheese was melted. It was fabulous! Tasted wonderful. Hubby went back for seconds but he did say that he would have preferred pasta in stead of polenta, but polenta is a nice change of pace and this is an excellent way to use it!
Great and unique. I love pizza and this was great. We used pepperoni sausage mushrooms and onions for toppings. Try u will like it too.
I made Polenta pizza today for lunch.It was awesome.
Cook polenta until it’s a bit more crispy instead of just heated through.
